document.s: Have you ever talked to a psychiatrist or a psychologist about an emotional problem?
Have you ever felt you needed help with an emotional problem?
Have you ever attempted to kill yourself?
In the past year, have you consumed any alcohol or...
Do-is this- this is going on record?
If I say "no," that means that I can be in it?
No, I haven't had any alcohol or anything like that.
Have you ever given in to an aggressive urge or impulse?
Uh, what do you mean by that?
Like, domestic violence or rape, incest no, no, no, no.
Have you ever experienced any emotional problems associated with your sexual interests or your choice of a sexual partner?
Why do you want to participate in this study?
I could use a little cash this summer.
I just saw the $15 a day.
I was looking through the ads, and it was just...
If selected for this study, would you rather be a guard or a prisoner?
I don't think I have the qualities to be a guard.
I-I wouldn't want to be a guard.
A prisoner sounds like it would be a little less work.
All right, we got a heads.
So we can just put him over there, yeah, with the prisoners.
Okay, so the last one's a guard.
I think we have our prisoners and our guards.
I am Dr. Phil Zimbardo, professor of psychology here at Stanford university.
You're gonna be very pleased to know that you all have been chosen to be the prison guards in this study.
And that choice was made based upon the exemplary qualities that you all demonstrated during your interviews.
This experiment will be an extension of my research into the effects prisons can have on human behavior.
And being that it's summer and the school's almost empty, we should have near complete privacy for this study.
And as you'll soon see, we have cleared out some of the teachers' offices and converted them into prison cells, and the hallway will serve as the prison yard.
But remember, just as you are watching the prisoners, my graduate staff and I will be watching you.
So under no circumstances whatsoever are you to hit or physically assault the prisoners in any way.
Now, you'll all be given sunglasses and uniforms to give the prisoners a sense of a unified, singular authority.
Once a prisoner is jailed, he will not be able to leave, except under established procedures.
And from this point forward, you should never refer to this as a study or an experiment again.
I don't even know where I got them.
The perils of moving in together.
You know, I'm gonna be away for two weeks, and then...
And then you are gonna be starting your new job.
You make it sound like it's in a different state.
Berkeley is an hour up the road.
It's just I don't know what the guys and I are gonna do without you.
No one's ever gonna take me seriously and- and my career seriously until I go out there and prove it on my own.
It could have been New York.
I made this decision for us.
Nobody deserves this more than you.
You were a great student of mine.
And you're gonna be a great professor.
You did miss a spot right over there.
That's- that's the name they gave me.
I'm placing you under arrest for violation of California penal code 211, armed robbery.
Hey, my brother didn't do anything.
Go-go on, tell mom I won't be home for dinner.
Hands on the car and spread 'em.
Which one of us should start?
You guys, this doesn't have to be- just keep your hands on the wall.
Okay, just keep your hands on the wall.
Uh, and take off your shoes.
Put your hands at your sides.
Now I want you to strip.
Maybe I could have some privacy first- shut up!
And put your clothes on the floor.
Put your clothes to the right.
Don't we have to delouse him first?
Uh, everybody, this is Jesse Fletcher.
He's gonna consult with us on the experiment.
We got Paul, Kyle, and you remember Mike.
Why don't you pull up a chair?
Put your arms above your head.
I don't mean to be rude, but what qualifies him to be here'?
Okay, boys, let's take her down there and show her just how pretty she looks.
From now on, you will be known as prisoner 8612 and only as 8612.
And you will, at all times, refer to us as Mr. Correctional Officer.
I mean, yes, sir, Mr. Correctional Officer, sir.
All right, um, let's take her down to cell number two.
What are you doing in here?
You brought me here to legitimize this experiment, and there's nothing legitimate about this place, Phil.
A loss of freedom, literally and symbolically.
Yeah, but that does not explain why they're wearing dresses.
We're trying to strip away their individuality...
Take away all the things that make them them.
You see, we're trying to understand how an institution affects an individual's behavior.
We're trying to do something good.
Well, nice to meet you, comrade.
They said something about burglary, but, uh,
I mean, I didn't really do anything.
We've been framed- framed, I tell ya!
You can sit down, you know.
Are you aware we're supposed to be quiet?
Yeah, you are aware they can't lay a finger on us.
We can do whatever we want.
I'm just saying I think it'll go a whole lot smoother if we do what we're told.
Prisoners are part of a Correctional community.
In order to keep the community running smoothly, prisoners must obey the following rules.
Prisoners must remain silent during rest periods, after lights out, during meals, and outside the prison yards.
Prisoners must eat at meal times and only at meal times.
Prisoners must participate in all prison activities.
Prisoners must address the guards as Mr. Correctional Officer and the warden as Mr. chief Correctional Officer.
You can call me, uh, warden from here on.
Hey, maybe tell the guards to lighten up a bit.
Ah rule violations to the guards.
Failure to obey any of the above rules may result in punishment.
All right, stand at attention for warden penny.
All of you have shown that you are unable to function in the real world.
You lack the responsibility of the good people of this great country.
Well, we are here to help you learn what your responsibilities are.
Now, if you follow the rules and keep your hands clean, if you repent for your misdeeds and show a proper attitude of penitence, well, we'll get along just fine, gentlemen.
Yeah, we kind of did all the hard work for you.
I can almost smell the pork.
Better pork than wearing a dress, dude.
You know who you look like?
You look like that guy from cool hand Luke.
You know, the one that kills Paul Newman at the end?
Now, I can be a nice guy, or I can be one real mean son of a bitch.
Oh, we should strike for better food.
Smoking is a privilege, 5704, one you're gonna have to earn.
It says in the contract, after mealtime- as for the rest of you prisoners...
I need not remind you of rule number one.
I don't want any more talking.
Thinks he's John Wayne or something.
Okay, is it just me, or...
Are these guys taking this thing a bit too seriously?
'Cause it seems to me like they're having more fun twirling their batons than I'm having with my balls hanging out of this fucking dress.
Yeah, 15 bucks that I really need.
Yeah, we all need it, but why should we be working twice as hard for it than these guys?
I'm thinking we need to make the guards earn their pay.
Visiting day is in two days.
We would like to give you the opportunity to write a letter to the person that you would like to have come visit.
In 30 minutes, you will be required to turn in a finished letter.
Whether or not your letter gets sent will be based on your behavior.
I have a question, Mr. chief Correctional Officer.
Uh, will we be allowed one phone call?
Yeah, yeah, Mr. chief Correctional Officer, um, my glasses...
Well, I- I mean, need them to see.
Your Correctional staff is here to serve you, 5486.
Mr. Correctional Officer, when will we know our sentence?
When judgment is passed on you.
Well, that is for the judge and the court to determine.
When are we gonna go to court?
That is also for the judge and the court to determine.
Uh, Mr. Correctional Officer, sir, uh, my pills...
I wasn't aware that you took medication, 3401.
Uh, well, they're vitamins, Mr. Correctional Officer.
Well, you get all the vitamins you need in the tasty, nutritious food we serve you, 3401.
Let's get to writing those letters, ladies.
"I'll do my best to organize the other prisoners and bring an end to this oppressive situation."
Well, clearly, he's not taking this very seriously.
This might be an interesting two weeks after all.
All right, gentlemen, we gonna have ourselves a little count.
Gonna be a lot of fun.
Maybe you didn't hear me right.
Why'd you have to look down'?
You know your name now, boy?
Then, 1037, don't look down at your dress next time.
I expect you to go again, faster.
Maybe them caps on your heads are a little too tight, gentlemen, 'cause that was slow as hell.
Since you guys can't go forwards, how about we try going backwards?
Yes, I did, Mr. Correctional Officer.
Well, just for that, you have to start all over again.
That's right, don't interrupt Mr. Correctional Officer.
- Tell you what you're gonna do.
Tell you what we're gonna do.
How about we try singing it?
That'll get the blood boiling a little bit.
I know you got a set of lungs on you, 5704.
I see any smiling, it's jumping Jacks.
819, how about you give me a couple jumping Jacks, if you find it so funny.
Since y'all find this so amusing, how about you come on out here and give me ten jumping Jacks, all y'all at the same time?
And sing it loud and clear.
nine, ten this John Wayne guy is remarkable.
From the second he stepped in the yard, he's been in complete control.
Now count it like you mean it.
I want it fast, I want it loud, and I want it clear.
That's how we want it done.
What are you so proud about, 7258?
Tell me the number of the dress to the man to your right.
Why don't you come out here and give me ten jumping Jacks after you tell me what number that is?
4325, tell me the number of the man standing to your right.
Well, since you had to look,
I want you to step up here,
I want you to do five push-ups, four jumping Jacks, then eight push-ups, then six jumping Jacks so you will remember the name of the man standing to your right and you won't have to look next time.
One, two, three, four, five, six.
Did y'all enjoy your counts this evening?
Maybe you'd enjoy a little time in the hole.
Anybody else not enjoy their counts?
Anybody else want to be honest here?
I think one of us needs to go home.
We got another two weeks of this.
Have fun down here in the dungeons of Jordan hall.
You want to go get some rest?
No, I'm gonna stay here a little bit more.
Don't none of these other prisoners get to sleep till you make your bed to my satisfaction.
And I assure you, all of those other prisoners are real tired from all those counts you made 'em do.
Oh, I hope you're not done yet.
I think your mama taught you to make a better bed than that.
I want those corners nice and neat.
Um, I'm sorry, Mr. Correctional Officer?
Just the same, 8612, why don't you come on out here in the hallway and give me 20 push-ups?
Count 'em off so everybody can hear them.
I don't think cell three can hear you.
Well, are you ready for me, 8612?
Them look like hospital corners to you?
I mean, we- we ran 'em pretty ragged.
You should've seen 8612's face when I made him remake his bed for the 12th time.
Little fucker looked at me like I just took a shit in his ice cream.
Thought he was gonna burst out crying right then and there.
Yeah, I mean, he might have.
Well, yeah, I mean, they don't really have a choice, you know?
I mean, you know, you're the boss man.
They got to do what you say.
Well, I guess we'll have to give 8612 a little extra attention tonight.
- Get the fuck out of bed!
- We just finally got to sleep.
We slept all day for this.
Now, this is an exercise period.
Each prisoner must complete the following:
It is up to the guards' discretion whether or not a prisoner shall do more.
You're finished when I say you're finished, 819.
That's what you told me to do.
Hey, everybody keeps going, unless 819 decides to join you for an additional 20.
You gonna do your 20, or are these guys gonna go till they drop?
What did you just call me?
I think you heard me, you fascist pig.
The rest of you, return to your cells immediately, have them neat and orderly, and be standing by the foot of your bed in three minutes.
Yes, it is, Mr. Correctional Officer.
Why don't you make up your bunk, 8612?
Well, that's not what I see.
- Take him, take him, take him.
Put him in the fucking hole.
Just put him in the hole!
You're not supposed to hit him.
You're not supposed to hit him.
You fix that nice and neat now.
That guy fucking hit me with his nightstick.
They're not allowed to do that.
Well, I did grab his throat first, but,
I got to tell you, it felt good.
I-I really don't think that's the way to go.
If we can convince the others, the odds favor us, man.
It's what they'd do in a real prison.
Wait, what are you- no talking, 8612!
Shit and fall in it, motherfucker!
There's only ever three of them.
How many more of us can they throw in here?
I want you to wash your dishes and return to your cells.
No, not- not until I get my glasses.
Don't be a pain in the ass.
I said I want my glasses.
Will you just give me my glasses?
I'm not gonna fucking come here!
Phil, hey, uh, you have to come see this.
Let the guards figure it out.
I think this whole thing is taking a turn for the worse.
Wait- wait, what's this all about?
At least the guards aren't hassling you in there.
I'd just about suck a dick for a cigarette.
You know, I got to say,
I'm very dissatisfied with this whole experience so far.
You know, I just want my pills.
Guys, 8612 and I were talking in the hole and, um...
I think we've got a plan.
Someone open this door immediately or face severe punishment.
Blow it out your ass, Mr. Correctional Officer!
Way to go, cell number one!
We're with you all the way!
Men, it's your job to keep my prison in order, and right now, there doesn't seem to be a whole lot of order out there.
Sir, they've blacked out their doors, and they- why am I hearing excuses?
Do not forget, you have all the authority.
And you're stronger than they are.
They're starting to create bonds with each other.
Establish some order before it gets out of control.
And don't forget, if you need to...
I need some help over here.
Hey, 8612, these guys are model prisoners.
What kind of fucking solidarity is that?
Do not even think about it.
It's right there, on the ground in front of you.
Come on, man, put your cap back on.
Help me get him on the ground.
Hey, what are you doing to him?
How do you like that, huh?

Cell two, as you can see, your Correctional staff has prepared a delicious, nutritious, and very special meal for the wonderful prisoners of cell three in appreciation of their good conduct this afternoon.
I'm not gonna tell you again.
What the fuck is wrong with you?
Okay, one thing, though- if only one of us gets away, we've got to send help to bust the other guys out.
I think that 8612's definitely been a little, um...
Well, that's the word you're gonna use?
Well, let's go back and look at his questionnaire.
We can't wait for this, man.
How the fuck do we get out of here, man?
I don't even know where we are.
I'm gonna need you to- order you to get back in your cells.
Oh, what the- go, go, go,
- You can't do this to us!
You're messing with- you can't fucking do this to us!
- You can't do this to us!
8612, you have proven to be a singular and terrible influence to all of your prisoners around you.
You will stay in the hole until further notice.
You will remain here, and you will remain silent until we fix the door to your cell.
Well, well, well, look at you three, all bright-eyed and bushy-tailed.
You know, you boys are in for a whole heap of trouble, but if you clear this here, uh, barricade,
I can spare you a shit storm the likes of which you never seen.
Well, that's how he wants it.
All right, now, up against the wall.
I leave all of y'all alone for less than a day, and look what happens.
You lose your beds, try to escape.
What is so goddamn wrong with all of y'all, huh?
This behavior will not be tolerated.
Why in god's name are you naked, boy?
Get him back his uniform, will you, boss?
I really need-l need to speak to a doctor or...
Maybe you'll think about that next time you get yourself put in the hole.
All right, you can fuck off, man!
I'am not nearly as cruel as my fellow colleagues on the day shift, your blankets will be returned to y'all and your dresses will be repaired.
However, should you feel the need to defecate or urinate, please feel free to do so in the fine buckets provided by your Correctional staff.
I feel so fucked up inside!
Let's bring him to the old classroom upstairs.
I understand you're not feeling well.
I've had this really bad headache all day, and, um, a couple hours ago,
I started feeling my stomach being all- being all knotted up.
And what is it you'd like for us to do about that?
I figured I ought to, you know, g-get out and go- go see a doctor...
Surely you're not suggesting that we release you from prison for a stomachache.
I just really don't feel well, and it would be really nice- bullshit!
You don't know what it's like down there.
What did you just say to me?
I said, "you don't know what it's like down there."
San Quentin, boy, 17 years of hard time.
Do you really think you can tell me what it's like on the inside?
You damn right you guess not.
Look me in my eye when I'm talking to you.
They'd knock your goddamn teeth out and pass you around like candy.
So why don't you tell us what the real problem is?
I mean, I really think the guards have gone a little bit overboard.
From what I've seen, I'd say you brought that on yourself.
Look, I'd just really like to get out of here, okay?
You know that you're the most rebellious one in here.
Maybe if you spent a little less time fighting, you wouldn't be so tired.
Yeah, but what am I supposed to do, just- don't interrupt me.
You telling me you can't handle, what, some push-ups, some jumping Jacks, guys calling you names?
Tell you what, I'll talk to the guards and tell them to go easy on you, all right?
Phil, I think we're done here.
I want to finish the conversation.
I don't want to do this.
Hey, you're not really gonna tell them to take it easy on him, are you?
There's no way he's getting out of here right now.
During meals and whenever they are in the prison yard.
Get your ass back in line, boy.
As I was saying, prisoners must remain silent during rest periods, after lights out, during meals, and outside the prison yard.
Prisoners must eat at meal times...
What do you mean, you couldn't get out of the contract?
No talking on the line, you two.
I mean I couldn't get out.
I mean they wouldn't let me out.
- Just get back in line here.
I want to see the warden!
You have no right to fuck with my head!
I'm beat up your fucking guards!
I want out, and I want out right now!
You're messing with my head, man.
You have no right to fuck with my head!
We-we hit a breaking point last night, and, um, 8612 is gone.
Well, the contract explicitly says that- do you understand how much time and energy, not to-not to mention money, has been spent on this experiment?
I leave for one shift, and you have tampered with the integrity of the entire enterprise.
The kid was in a serious crisis.
He was threatening to harm himself and-
I'm the superintendent of this facility.
- We- did you even stop to think, for one second, if 8612, just like Jesse said yesterday, was bullshitting you?
What is it with these lawyers?
Well, then, why did 8612 lose it'?
What did we miss in the screening process?
He was only in there for two days.
Yeah, but without any sunlight and sleep, your sense of time has been totally altered.
His only weakness was that he resisted.
He didn't bend, so he broke.
No, he broke because he couldn't control the other prisoners.
Even as a prisoner with essentially no rights?
8612 was fine while other people were serving him.
You think if the other prisoners had stuck with him, then, what, John Wayne would have lost?
I don't buy any of this.
No, I don't imagine you would.
You're basing your conclusions off your own experience- on real felons in a real prison.
So this is not a prison?
This is 18 college boys who's never been punched in the fucking face.
I think you guys are both missing the point.
The only thing that separates those two was a coin flip.
All right, what steps are being taken to replace 8612?
Start notifying the alternates immediately, okay?
And find out which ones can start tomorrow.
Until then, what do you want me to tell the prisoners?
Tell them 8612 has been taken to maximum security.
Get some more fear into them.
As you know, today is visiting day.
For the sake of your friends and family,
I want this place made presentable.
That means cleaning up the mess you've made, as well as cleaning up yourselves.
Out of respect for your loved ones,
I want you to put on the outward appearance of self-dignity, confidence, love, happiness, even if you have none.
You never had it this good, have you, 2093?
No, I haven't, Mr. Correctional Officer.
So you never want to go home, huh?
I don't have a home, Mr. Correctional Officer.
Been living in my car all this summer.
Y'all, uh, y'all see how good you got it now, don't you, huh?
Well, you best remember that when you're talking to your visitors.
Hey, um, you guys should hear this.
So this was taken a couple of hours ago from the mic in cell two.
I was talking to the big guard, and he told me that they had him locked up in maximum security.
I'm telling you, he's at home.
That breakdown was some jive acting.
When we tried to escape, he said if either of us make it out, that-that we'd come back and then bust the rest of the guys out.
You know, it's actually not so bad if you just cooperate.
Ever since I was stripped down, bare naked, I have been.
Yeah, 'cause, see, I got most of the rules memorized, except for the- I guess, the new ones we get at the guards' discretion.
Tell him the most important rule, 4325.
The most important rule is always obey the guards,
Can they tell you to do anything?
What right do they have to do that?
Well, the guards run the prison.
Well, aren't there certain rights that they have to respect, I mean- well, prisoners have no rights.
Well, I think maybe they do.
Probably just a little too much time in the hole.
I don't think you're supposed to talk about the hole.
If something isn't right, you can let us know.
Uh, Mr. Zimbardo, we don't mean to make any trouble, but we're just a bit concerned about our son.
Well, what-what- what seems to be the problem?
Honestly, he looks like he hasn't slept in a week.
Is there anything wrong with your boy?
I-I-that's what has me so concerned.
We are recreating a prison environment here, and one of the ways that we do that is by instituting regular counts.
Some of those counts take place very late at night.
To be honest, Mrs. Mitchell, we're all very tired, but everybody else seems to be handling it pretty well, and...
Your son seems to be a pretty tough kid.
Do you think he can handle it?
We've wasted enough of the man's time.
I think we're gonna double up on security tonight.
He wants to come back, break the other prisoners out, okay?
Right, he wants to play a little cat and mouse game, that's fine.
I'll play a little cat and mouse game with him, but I'm not gonna let him screw up our work.
I'm gonna personally sit guard myself tonight.
Phil, you know, we actually were just talking- that it might be a good idea for you to get some rest tonight.
No, a good idea right now is to keep our prison safe.
I expect you guys to be a little bit sharper than this, okay?
Are we on the same page?
Can we be on the same page?
What are you- what are you doing down here?
I'm actually waiting for one of my subjects to arrive.
I saw some of your boys earlier in the hallway.
Well, I would love to- to sit and chat with you, Jim, but I'm actually in the middle of it right now.
What's the independent variable in your study?
Have you introduced a variable that might influence your outcome?
I just- well, while I would love to sit here and explain my prison to you,
I actually have more pressing matters than whether or not you understand the academics of my work.
I'll see you again when the semester begins.
Hey- looks like 8612 is a no-show for tonight.
Let's get Kyle and Vogel and meet in the conference room.
I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but Kyle's gone.
What the fuck do you mean, gone?
He, uh-he had a death in the family.
I mean, I'm sorry, but, fuck, this could not have come at a worse time.
It's been days since he got out, and he didn't come.
Hasn't even been a day yet.
How are we even supposed to know?
He told us he would come get us.
Yeah, well, he also started to think that all this was real.
You got to pull it together, all right?
We've only got another week in here.
We're not even gonna last another night.
They don't even do that in real prisons.
Do we have a problem here?
I want to see a doctor.
See if you can find one in there.
So how are you holding up?
I'm here to provide guidance and counsel to the prisoners in this jail.
So what measures are you taking to get out of prison?
Entirely sure if I understand the question.
Has bail been set in your case yet?
If it has, sir, I'm unaware of it.
I wasn't aware that I was, um, supposed to...
Well, son, just how do you suppose you're ever going to get out of here without one?
Wha- why-why would I need a lawyer for an experiment'?
Well, I don't know what experiment you're referring to, but you've got to take control of your situation here, son.
Come on, 819, you're the last one up, buddy.
All right, let's start with your name, son.
It's not a trick question, son.
And what steps are you taking to secure your release?
What-what steps am I- am I what?
I don't know why you're asking me this.
I don't know what any of this means.
I didn't know I had to take steps to secure my release.
I don't know what you're talking about!
Have you spoken to your lawyer?
I have an uncle who's a lawyer.
I could call him, but I don't- that sounds like a good start.
All right, all right, just calm down.
- No, look, I'm sorry, but- can I just see a doctor or call my parents?
I just need a little help right now, and I- please, can I just see a doctor or something?
Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey- hey, everything's gonna be all right.
Listen, what I'm gonna do is, we're gonna clear out of this room, get a nice meal brought in here.
If you're still feeling bad this afternoon, we'll call a doctor, okay?
Okay, so I'm assuming that you've all seen and heard the mess that your fellow prisoner has created for us this afternoon.
So I want you all to say now, after me,
Okay, that's great, but I said loudly enough so that he can hear you.
I think it really did make a difference.
What you're doing here, it's a good thing.
It'll teach these boys of privilege what a prison is.
I couldn't agree with you more.
They can shut this whole place down.
He wasn't here ten minutes, and he became part of the experiment.
Even if he did call a lawyer, why should that be any different?
They think I'm a bad prisoner, but I'm not, I swear I'm not.
You're not even a prisoner at all.
With a bunch of empty offices in the basement of Jordan hall.
All you have to do is sign a couple of release papers.
Jesus, Phil, why did you do that?
Hey, he was a lost cause.
I can't afford any more liabilities.
I'm not letting anything get in the way of the progress that we made-
And will you make sure that he takes him to student health and gets him checked out?
Hey, did you find a replacement for 8612'?
There's not that many people left on campus.
Oh, I'm so glad you came.
Well, it's quiet right now, but it-it has been truly extraordinary the way these boys have adapted.
Well, you're gonna have me around for a while.
So I'm volunteering to take his place on the parole board.
Now you'll get to see what it's really like.
And then the chimp raped the woman.
- And she had a baby that-
Literally, every story you tell is a bullshit lie.
And the baby was half chimp and half human.
It had, like, sideburns and shit, like those.
Hey, let's go, new guy eat a no thank you, Mr. Correctional Officer.
Well, that is not an option, 416.
Well, I'm sorry you think that, sir.
How about you pick up those sausages, boy?
Now, you will not leave this closet until those sausages are in your belly.
I believe the Correctional staff has convinced me of my many weaknesses.
Despite my horrible disrespect for them, the staff has treated me well.
I now know that every member of the Correctional staff is only interested in the well-being of the prisoners.
And I believe that because of their goodness,
I have been rehabilitated and transformed into a better human being.
On a personal note, the prisoner adds,
This being my last year at Stanford,
